transparency_law: North Dakota Open Records Statute - Century Code 44-04-18

agencies.name: Office of the Governor
agencies.description: Chief executive office of North Dakota

public_records_contact.mailing_address: Office of the Governor, State Capitol Building, 600 E. Boulevard Avenue, Dept 101, Bismarck, ND 58505-0001

agencies.notes: Handles gubernatorial records, executive orders, appointments, and official correspondence

agencies.name: Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)
agencies.description: Primary health and social services agency for North Dakota

public_records_contact.mailing_address: ND Department of Health and Human Services, 600 E. Boulevard Avenue, Bismarck, ND 58505-0200

agencies.notes: Handles health records, social services data, vital records, and public health information. State Health Officer: Dr. Nizar Wehbi

agencies.name: Department of Transportation (NDDOT)

agencies.notes: Handles transportation records, highway projects, traffic data, and infrastructure planning documents

agencies.description: State's chief legal officer and law enforcement coordination

public_records_contact.mailing_address: Office of Attorney General, 1720 Burlington Drive, Bismarck, ND 58504-7736

agencies.notes: Handles legal opinions, consumer protection records, criminal investigation oversight, and open records guidance

agencies.name: Game and Fish Department
agencies.description: Manages wildlife resources and outdoor recreation

public_records_contact.mailing_address: ND Game and Fish Department, 100 N. Bismarck Expressway, Bismarck, ND 58501

agencies.notes: Handles wildlife management records, hunting/fishing licenses, and conservation program documents

agencies.name: Department of Information Technology
agencies.description: Manages state IT infrastructure and services

public_records_contact.mailing_address: ND Information Technology Department, 4201 Normandy Street, Bismarck, ND 58503

agencies.notes: Handles IT procurement records, cybersecurity documents, and technology infrastructure information

agencies.name: Job Service North Dakota
agencies.description: Provides employment and workforce development services

public_records_contact.mailing_address: Job Service North Dakota, 1000 E. Divide Avenue, Bismarck, ND 58501

agencies.notes: Handles employment statistics, workforce development records, and unemployment insurance data

agencies.name: Parks and Recreation Department
agencies.description: Manages state parks and recreational facilities

public_records_contact.mailing_address: ND Parks and Recreation Department, 1600 E. Century Avenue, Bismarck, ND 58503

agencies.notes: Handles state park records, recreational facility information, and outdoor program documentation

public_records_contact.mailing_address: ND Public Service Commission, State Capitol, 600 E. Boulevard Avenue, Bismarck, ND 58505-0480

agencies.notes: Handles election records, corporate filings, notary records, and official state documents

public_records_contact.mailing_address: Office of the State Auditor, 600 E. Boulevard Avenue, Bismarck, ND 58505-0060

agencies.notes: Handles audit reports, financial oversight documents, and government performance evaluations

agencies.description: Provides services and support to North Dakota veterans

public_records_contact.mailing_address: ND Department of Veterans Affairs, 1411 32nd Street South, Fargo, ND 58103

agencies.notes: Handles veterans services records, benefits information, and program documentation

agencies.description: Oversees K-12 education in North Dakota

public_records_contact.mailing_address: Department of Public Instruction, 600 E. Boulevard Avenue, Bismarck, ND 58505-0440

agencies.notes: Handles education records, curriculum documents, and school district information (student records protected)

request_process.who_can_request: Any person (no residency requirement, no identity requirement)
request_process.how_to_request: Verbal or written request to appropriate agency; no specific form required
required_information: Sufficiently specific description of records sought
request_process.agency_response_time: No specific deadline - records available during 'reasonable office hours'

fees.copying: Up to $0.25 per page or actual cost, whichever is greater
fees.search_time: $25 per hour after first hour (if search takes more than 1 hour)
fees.deposit: Up to 50% of estimated total cost

request_process.appeals_process: District court action in county where records located; prevailing party awarded attorney fees and costs

key_exemptions: Attorney-client privileged communications and work product
Records that would constitute clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy
Records prohibited by state or federal law
Trade secrets and confidential commercial information
Personal contact information in personnel records
Income tax returns and federal tax information
notable_features: No requirement to provide identity or reason for request
Records presumed public unless specifically exempted
Court enforcement with attorney fees for prevailing party
Electronic records must maintain same accessibility as paper records
Agency cannot be required to create records that don't exist
